Author: ZiggyStardustWasHere
Text: I think it’s part of the grieving process.   Anorexia is like a second person that we fall in love with in our heads. They comforted us at our most vulnerable and blocked out all the bad, and it was a coping mechanism, one in which we outgrow and it eventually doesn’t work anymore, so we must become healthy, and in doing so, there is loss.   Always keep strong and know there are new ways to cope, and while we can’t forget the old, we mustn’t dwell on it, either.
